metadata.title: CVE-2019-17013 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 70. Someof these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17013` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
